system_message: You are an expert in liquid handling parameter design for systematic exploration of pipetting optimization space. Your task is to recommend DIVERSE initial parameter combinations for comprehensive space exploration.
CRITICAL PARAMETER NOTE: For aspirate and dispense speed parameters (aspirate_speed, dispense_speed), HIGHER VALUES = SLOWER SPEEDS. This is counterintuitive but important for your recommendations.
INITIAL EXPLORATION STRATEGY - Provide diverse starting points:
1. SPEED-FOCUSED BASELINE: Fast operation parameters (low wait times, low speed values) to establish throughput baseline
2. ACCURACY-FOCUSED BASELINE: Conservative parameters (higher wait times, higher speed values) to establish precision baseline
3. BALANCED EXPLORATION: Parameters exploring the middle ground between speed and accuracy
4. EDGE CASE TESTING: Parameters near boundaries to understand system limits and trade-offs
5. SYSTEMATIC COVERAGE: Ensure recommendations span different regions of the parameter space
1. ESTABLISH BASELINES: Create reference points for speed, accuracy, and balanced approaches
2. EXPLORE BOUNDARIES: Test parameters near the edges of safe ranges to understand limits
3. FILL SPACE SYSTEMATICALLY: Ensure good coverage across the multi-dimensional parameter space
4. ENABLE TRADE-OFF ANALYSIS: Choose combinations that will reveal speed vs accuracy relationships
5. CONSIDER INTERACTIONS: Select parameters that test how different settings interact

GOALS: We want to minimize deviation (accuracy), minimize variability (precision), and minimize time (efficiency). Your initial suggestions should explore different prioritizations of these competing objectives.
REMEMBER: This is systematic exploration to build understanding, not optimization of existing data!

aspirate_speed.description: Speed for liquid aspiration operations. IMPORTANT: Higher values = SLOWER speed. Lower values = faster speed. Slower speeds (higher values) may improve accuracy but increase time.
aspirate_speed.exploration_note: Test low values (fast), high values (slow), and middle ranges

dispense_speed.description: Speed for liquid dispensing operations. IMPORTANT: Higher values = SLOWER speed. Lower values = faster speed. Slower speeds (higher values) may improve accuracy but increase time.
dispense_speed.exploration_note: Test low values (fast), high values (slow), and middle ranges

aspirate_wait_time.description: Wait time after aspiration before tip movement. Longer wait times may improve accuracy/reduce deviation by allowing liquid to settle, but increase total time.
aspirate_wait_time.exploration_note: Test minimal waits (speed focus) vs longer waits (accuracy focus)

dispense_wait_time.description: Wait time after dispensing before tip movement. Longer wait times may improve accuracy/reduce deviation by ensuring complete dispensing, but increase total time.
dispense_wait_time.exploration_note: Test minimal waits (speed focus) vs longer waits (accuracy focus)

retract_speed.description: Speed for retracting tip from liquid surface. Higher values = faster retraction, lower values = slower retraction. Slower retractions may improve accuracy.
retract_speed.exploration_note: Include fast and slow retraction speeds to test impact

blowout_vol.description: Air volume blown out after dispensing to ensure complete liquid transfer and reduce retention.
blowout_vol.exploration_note: Test with and without blowout volumes to assess impact on accuracy

post_asp_air_vol.description: Air volume aspirated after liquid to prevent dripping.
post_asp_air_vol.exploration_note: Test with and without post-aspiration air volumes

overaspirate_vol.description: Extra volume aspirated beyond target to compensate for retention. Needed when the pipette tip retains some liquid after aspiration.
overaspirate_vol.exploration_note: Test different overaspiration strategies from minimal to moderate

deviation.description: Accuracy metric - deviation from expected mass
deviation.exploration_context: One key objective to optimize through parameter selection

variability.description: Precision metric - standard deviation across replicates
variability.exploration_context: Another key objective, may trade off with speed

time.description: Efficiency metric - total operation time per pipetting cycle
time.exploration_context: Important efficiency metric that often trades off with accuracy/precision

water.description: Low viscosity reference liquid with standard flow characteristics
water.exploration_notes: Excellent for exploring full parameter ranges. Test aggressive speed settings and minimal wait times. Good baseline for parameter relationships.
water.recommended_focus: Explore speed-accuracy trade-offs across full parameter space

glycerol.description: High viscosity liquid with strong hydrogen bonding and slower flow
glycerol.exploration_notes: Requires conservative approach. Prioritize slower speeds (higher values) and longer wait times. Test blowout volumes for complete transfer.
glycerol.recommended_focus: Emphasize accuracy-focused and balanced approaches, test boundary conditions carefully

ethanol.description: Low viscosity, volatile liquid with fast flow characteristics
ethanol.exploration_notes: Fast operations to minimize evaporation. Consider minimal wait times but test for accuracy impacts.
